CommonNomenclature.description:
Common list of values for specific information attributes required for the reporting of annual information in acoordance with Decision 2/CMA.3, annex, chapter IV (Reporting).
Pursuant to Decsion 2/CMA.4, Annex I, paragraph 28.
Attributes are listed in Decsion 2/CMA.4, paragraph 17(j), Annex I, paragraph 5.

CooperativeApproach.description:
Cooperative approaches under Article 6.2.
The format of the string is "CANNNN" where the "CA" is the fixed prefix, and NNNN is a four-digit integer, that shall be incremented by one for each additional agreed cooperative approach, and added to his common nomenclature.

definedValues.description: Article 6.4 mechanism (between Parties to the Paris Agreement)
Promotion of climate smart agriculture practices for sustainable rice cultivation in Ghana (between Ghana and Switzerland)

Operation of e-buses on privately owned, scheduled public bus routes in the Bangkok Metropolitan area by Energy Absolute / Implementing Agreement to the Paris Agreement between the Kingdom of Thailand and the Swiss Confederation (between Switzerland and Thailand)
Electrification of Vanuatuâ€™s Inhabited Islands through Solar Power ITMO Programme (between Switzerland and Vanuatu)
Emissions Reductions from Sustainable Management of Forests (by Guyana)

ITMOs resulting from Paris Agreement Article 5.2: reducing emissions from deforestation and forest degradation, and the role of conservation, sustainable management of forests and enhancement of forest carbon stocks (by Suriname)

OriginatingPartyRegistry.description: ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 or alpha-3 code of participating party in which the mitigation outcomes originated.

FirstID.description:
Identifier of the first ITMO in the block, commencing with First ID, ending with Last ID.
Blocks from the same Originating Party Registry cannot overlap.

LastID.description:
Identifier of the last ITMO in the block, commencing with First ID, ending with Last ID.
Blocks from the same Originating Party Registry cannot overlap.

FirstTransferringParty.description: ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 or alpha-3 code of participating party registry that initiates the "First Transfer".

FirstTransfer.description:
Definition of "first transfer" pursuant to decision, 2/CMA.3, Annex, paragraph 2.
Therefore defines the "First Transferring Party.".
AEF fields: Definition of "First transferring participating Party ID".

definedValues.description: First transfer defined for ITMOs that are authorized for NDC pursuant 2 (a), Annex, 2/CMA.3.
First transfer defined for ITMOs that are authorized for OIMP pursuant 2 (b)(1) Authorisation, Annex, 2/CMA.3.
First transfer defined for ITMOs that are authorized for OIMP pursuant 2 (b)(2) Issuance, Annex, 2/CMA.3.
First transfer defined for ITMOs that are authorized for OIMP pursuant 2 (b)(3) Use or Cancellation, Annex, 2/CMA.3.

Vintage.description: Year in which mitigation outcome occured.

Sector.description: One of more sectors where the mitigation outcome occurred as per common nomenclatures based on IPCC guidelines.

definedValues.description: Methane reduction nitrous oxide emission reduction are some examples of initiatives aimed at the agriculture sector, sustainable fish production, etc.
Zero-energy and passive houses, green roofs and walls for urban buildings, smart grids and building automation systems, sustainable urban drainage systems, climateadaptive urban planning.
ITMOs that cannot be associated to a specific sector since they are the net flow of mitigation outcomes coming from a different mechanism.
Wind farms, offshore wind power, solar farms, hydroelectric plants, geothermal heating and cooling solutions or biomass energy, etc.
Mangrove restoration, seagrass plantation, urban forestry and green spaces development, peatland restoration and conservation, soil carbon enhancement, land-use planning for reduced urban sprawl.
Fuel switching, carbon capture and storage (CCS), green chemistry, waste gas and heat recovery.

Hydrogen fuel cell vehicles and refueling infrastructure, sustainable biofuels for aviation and shipping, electric public transit systems, active transport infrastructure (bike lanes, pedestrian zones), smart logistics and freight transport efficiency.
Vegetative cover, afforestation, permeable surfaces, green roofs, rain gardens, bioretention swales, natural and constructed wetlands, converting abandoned industrial sites into urban parks.

Methane capture from landfills, waste-to-energy projects, Advanced recycling technologies, Biogas generation from organic waste, Circular economy models for industries (sharing, repairing, recycling), and the reduction of organic waste through composting and anaerobic digestion.

ActivityType.description: The mitigation activity type(s) from which the ITMOs were generated.

definedValues.description: Projects that involve the afforestation of land.
Projects aimed at reducing emissions from agricultural practices.
Projects that generate energy from biogas.
Projects that generate energy from biomass resources.
Projects in the cement industry aimed at reducing emissions.
Projects that involve the usage of captured CO2.
Projects that capture and utilize methane from coal beds or mines.
Projects aimed at improving the efficiency of energy distribution.
Projects aimed at improving energy efficiency in households.
Projects aimed at improving energy efficiency in the industrial sector.
Projects aimed at improving energy efficiency in own generation facilities.
Projects aimed at improving energy efficiency in the service sector.
Projects aimed at improving energy efficiency on the supply side.
Projects that switch from fossil fuels to cleaner energy sources.
Projects that capture fugitive emissions from industrial processes.
Projects that generate energy from geothermal sources.
Projects that generate electricity from hydroelectric sources.
Projects that capture and utilize landfill gas for energy production.
Projects that avoid methane emissions through various methods.
Projects that reduce emissions of nitrous oxide (N2O).
Projects that reduce emissions of perfluorocarbons (PFCs) and sulfur hexafluoride (SF6).
Projects that involve the reforestation of land.
Projects that generate electricity from solar power.
Projects that generate electricity from tidal energy.
Projects aimed at reducing emissions from transport.
Projects aimed at reducing waste and emissions from waste management.
Projects that generate electricity from wind power.

Metric.description: The metric used to measure the ITMO

definedValues.description: ITMO is meansured in tonnes Carbon Dioxide equivalent
ITMO is not measured in tonnes Carbon Dioxide equivalent

ActionType.description: Actions to be reported by Partipating Parties, pursuant Decision 2/CMA.3, Annex, paragraph 20(a), paragraph 29.

definedValues.description: Used when reporting the authorization of an ITMO.
Used when reporting the international transfer of an ITMO.
Used when reporting the international transfer of an ITMO.
Used when reporting the international acquisition of an ITMO.
Used when reporting the use of an ITMO.
Used when reporting the cancellation of an ITMO.
Used when reporting the cancellation of an ITMO.
ITMOs that are authorized to be used towards NDC achievement.
ITMOs that are authorized to be used for cancelled for other international mitigation purposes.

ITMOs that are authorized to be used towards NDC achievement;
and be used or cancelled for other international mitigation purposes.

Purpose.description:
Purpose for which ITMO has been used towards IMP or cancelled for OP.
Only applicable to action types "Use" and "Cancellation".
AEF fields: Purposes for which ITMO has been used towards or cancelled for OIMP

ParticipatingParty.description:
Standard codes for identifying participating parties under Article 6.2 of the Paris Agreement.
ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 or alpha-3 code of the Party's country.
Exceptionally reserved code elements, such as EU for the European Union, are also allowed.

AccountType.description: Minimum Account Types supported by the mechanism registry, under Article 6.4, Decision 7.CMA.4, Annex I - paragraph 32

definedValues.description:
Pending.
Account type to which all A6.4ERs or CERs shall be issued.

Holding.
Account Type which may acquire A6.4ERs or CERs tracked in the mechanism registry.

Share of Proceeds of Adaptation.
Account type which receives A4.6ERs in accordance with paragraph 58 of the RMPs.

Mandatory cancellation for OMGE.
Account type for mandatory cancellation of A6.4ERs for OMGE in accordance with paragraph 59 of the RMPs.

Voluntary cancellation for OMGE.
Account type for voluntary cancellation of A6.4ERs for OMGE in accordance with paragraph 70 of the RMPs.

Retirement.
Account type for retirement of A6.4ERs and CERs.

Cancellation for OIMP.
Account type for cancellation of A6.4ERs for OIMP.

Voluntary cancellation for other purposes.
Account type for voluntary cancellation of A6.4ERs for other purposes.

Administrative cancellation.
Account type for administrative cancellation of A6.4ERs and CERs tracked in the mechanism registry for corrective actions and other purposes, as necessary.
